definition: bassoon
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Guan

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: You could ask for our second engineer for tools if necessary .
sentences.chinese: 如果有必要的話，你可以找我們的大管輪要工具。

sentences.english: Serenade for flute, oboe, clarinet, horn and bassoon, Music-making in the Forest.
sentences.chinese: 單簧管，圓號，大管版小夜曲，音樂在森林中完成。

sentences.english: We choose the rigs through calculating the strength of canopy back to towing bassoon.
sentences.chinese: 通過計算大管棚的回拖力來選擇鑽機。

sentences.english: Appendix 14 A provides a fuller checklist of items a butler needs.
sentences.chinese: 列舉了作爲一名大管家所需要的物品清單。

sentences.english: His brother is an outstanding bassoon player.
sentences.chinese: 他的哥哥是一名出色的大管演奏家。

definition: double bass/contrabass
cello/violoncello/CL:把[ba3]
instrument of the violin family (violin, viola, cello or double bass)/CL:把[ba3]
to perform (a concerto)
variant of 揚琴|扬琴[yang2 qin2]
to offer a libation/person who performs the libation before a banquet/senior member of a profession/important government post in imperial China
daruan or bass lute, like pipa 琵琶 and zhongruan 中阮 but bigger and lower range
zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
xylophone
third (musical interval, e.g. do-mi)
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
plumber/pipe-worker
jing'erhu, a two-stringed fiddle intermediate in size and pitch between the jinghu 京胡 and erhu 二胡, used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京胡
